title: Distributed Autonomous Online Learning: Regrets and Intrinsic Privacy-Preserving Properties
abstract: Online learning is becoming increasingly popular for training on large datasets. However, the sequential nature of online learning requires a centralized learner to store data and update parameters. In this paper, we consider a fully decentralized setting, cooperative autonomous online learning, with a distributed data source. The learners perform learning with local parameters while periodically communicating with a small subset of neighbors to exchange information. We define the regret in terms of an implicit aggregated parameter of the learners for such a setting and prove regret bounds similar to the classical sequential online learning.
